title: Review of manure irrigation practices and issues

tasks.task: Operating a manure irrigation system on a farm.
subtasks: Understanding manure irrigation as part of a manure application system.
Recognizing the need for minor solid removal before manure irrigation.
Selecting appropriate nozzle types for manure irrigation (medium to coarse droplets).
Controlling application rate and pressure to manage droplet size.
Lowering the release height of nozzles for optimal droplet movement.
Monitoring and adjusting for wind speed to minimize drift and odor.
Using barriers and edge-of-field buffers to mitigate odor and drift.
Considering setback distances from homes, wells, and surface water to protect against potential impacts.
Managing application timing to maximize nutrient uptake and minimize environmental issues.
Allocating tanker loads effectively between traditional and irrigation-based manure applications.
Addressing odor concerns from manure irrigation systems.
Minimizing air quality impacts through proper equipment selection and operation.
Understanding the potential for particulate matter and greenhouse gas emissions.
